title: Research clean minimal mobile UI patterns
description: Validate visual design direction for the calm state app. Research clean, minimal mobile UIs similar to Headspace/Calm. Validate typography choices (Inter vs Nunito). Explore icon options for emotional states. Goal: establish visual language that feels calm, trustworthy, and instant.
design:
Research areas:
1. Mobile wellness app UI patterns (Headspace, Calm, Balance, etc.)
2. Typography: evaluate Inter vs Nunito for calm/friendly feel
3. Icon systems for emotional states (8 states initially)
4. Color palettes: soft gradients, low saturation
5. Breathing/focus animations reference
6. Touch target sizes for frictionless tapping
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Typography recommendation with rationale
- [ ] Icon style recommendation (custom vs library)
- [ ] Color palette proposal (gradients, backgrounds, text)
- [ ] Reference screenshots/links collected
- [ ] Animation style direction documented
notes:
COMPLETED: Comprehensive UI research via 6 parallel Opus agents (Jan 2026)

## Key Findings Summary:

### Typography: NUNITO recommended (over Inter)
- Rounded terminals = softer, friendlier feel for wellness
- Alternative: Lexend for maximum accessibility
- Inter too clinical/utilitarian for calm app

### Icons: HYBRID APPROACH
- Phosphor Icons for general UI (6 weights, duotone)
- Custom abstract shapes for 8 emotional states
- Avoid literal emoji faces (cultural sensitivity)
- Abstract organic shapes: scattered dots (anxious), overlapping circles (overwhelmed), etc.

### Color Palette: LOW SATURATION
- Primary Blue: #4A90C2 (muted, not harsh)
- Background: #FAF8F5 (warm white, not pure)
- Sage Green: #8FAE94 (success states)
- Dark mode: #121418 (blue-tinted black)
- Full CSS variables provided

### Tech Stack: VALIDATED with refinements
- Vite 7.x (not beta 8) - CONFIRMED
- Preact 11 (3KB) over React (40KB) - NEW RECOMMENDATION
- Tailwind CSS v4 for styling
- preact-iso for routing (~1KB)
- vite-plugin-pwa v1.2.x - CONFIRMED

### Animations: CSS + Web Animations API
- Transform + opacity only (GPU accelerated)
- No Lottie (150KB+ overkill for simple orbs)
- Haptic feedback via Vibration API
- Code examples provided

### Touch Targets: 56-64px for stressed users
- WCAG AAA: 44px minimum
- Anxious users need larger targets
- 12-16px gaps between targets

### UI Patterns from Headspace/Calm/Balance:
- Warm neutrals, soft gradients
- Generous whitespace
- One decision per screen ✓
- Max 2 screens to exercise ✓
close_reason: Research complete. All acceptance criteria met: typography, icons, colors, animations, and stack validated.

title: Set up Vite PWA project scaffolding
description: Initialize the Vite project with PWA support, routing, and base structure. Android-first PWA that works offline after first load.
design:
Stack (from research):
- Vite 7.x (stable)
- Preact 11.x (not React)
- preact-iso for routing
- Tailwind CSS v4
- vite-plugin-pwa v1.2.x
- TypeScript 5.x

See RESEARCH_FINDINGS.md for full details.

Setup steps:
1. npm create vite@latest . -- --template preact-ts
2. npm install preact-iso
3. npm install -D vite-plugin-pwa @vite-pwa/assets-generator
4. npm install -D tailwindcss @tailwindcss/vite
5. Configure vite.config.ts with PWA + Tailwind plugins
6. Set up routing (/, /s/:state, /x/:exerciseId)
7. Create manifest.json with app metadata
